member.name: F:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.m_tsDurationTime
member.summary: Member variable to hold the video's duration or length.

member.name: F:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.m_tsCurrentVideoTime
member.summary: Member variable to hold the video's current time.

member.name: F:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.m_blFirstTick
member.summary: Member variable to hold whether or not this is the first tick in the System.Timer's tick events

member.name: F:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.m_blChapter
member.summary: Member variable to hold UNKNOWN

member.name: F:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.m_blRecordPerSecond
member.summary: Member variable to hold whether or not to record data every second

member.name: F:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.m_blIsEndOfVideo
member.summary: Member variable to hold whether or not the video is at the end

member.name: F:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.m_dblRate
member.summary: Member variable to hold the rate the video will be played at

member.name: F:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.m_strFilename
member.summary: Member variable to hold the filename

member.name: F:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.m_sngFPS
member.summary: Member variable to hold the frames per second for the video

member.name: F:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.m_mbMedia
member.summary: Member variable to hold the media (video file)

member.name: F:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.m_pnlTransparentPanel
member.summary: Member variable to hold the transparent panel used to overlay the Vlc.DotNet control so that the user can click on the video to toggle play/pause

member.name: P:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.Position
member.summary: This property contains the position of the currently loaded video.

member.name: P:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.IsPlaying
member.summary: This property is readonly and contains a boolean which is True if the media state of the VLC.dotnet control is Vlc.DotNet.Core.Interops.Signatures.LibVlc.Media.States.Playing

member.name: P:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.IsStopped
member.summary: This property is readonly and contains a boolean which is True if the media state of the VLC.dotnet control is Vlc.DotNet.Core.Interops.Signatures.LibVlc.Media.States.Stopped

member.name: P:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.IsPaused
member.summary: This property is readonly and contains a boolean which is True if the media state of the VLC.dotnet control is Vlc.DotNet.Core.Interops.Signatures.LibVlc.Media.States.Paused

member.name: P:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.IsEndOfVideo
member.summary: This property contains a boolean which is True if the media has reached the end of the video

member.name: P:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.CurrentVideoTime
member.summary: This property is readonly and contains a System.Timespan object which represents the time at the current position of the video

member.name: P:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.FPS
member.summary: This property is readonly and contains a number of type 'Single' which represents the Frames per Second for the video.
member.remarks: Note this almost always returns 0 so it's use is limited

member.name: P:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.Rate
member.summary: This property contains a number of type 'Double' which represents the play rate for the video. For normal playback this will be 1.0. For double spped, it will be 2.0
member.value: Double number greater or equal to 0.0

member.name: P:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.Filename
member.summary: This property contains a 'String' which represents the filename for the video.

member.name: E:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.PauseEvent
member.summary: This event is triggered when the user pauses the video from within the fmrVideoPlayer form. It is handled by myFormLibrary.frmVideoMiner.playerPaused.

member.name: E:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.PlayEvent
member.summary: This event is triggered when the user plays the video from within the fmrVideoPlayer form. It is handled by myFormLibrary.frmVideoMiner.playerPlaying.

member.name: E:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.StopEvent
member.summary: This event is triggered when the user stops the video from within the fmrVideoPlayer form. It is handled by myFormLibrary.frmVideoMiner.playerStopped.

member.name: E:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.EndedEvent
member.summary: This event is triggered when the video has ended. It is handled by plyrVideo_Ended.

member.name: E:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.EndedBroadcastEvent
member.summary: This event is triggered when the video has ended. It is handled by myFormLibrary.frmVideoMiner.videoEnded

member.name: E:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.ClosingEvent
member.summary: This event is triggered when the frmVideoPlayer form is closed by clicking the 'X' top right of the window. It is handled by myFormLibrary.frmVideoMiner.playerClosing

member.name: M:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.frmVideoPlayer_Load(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Loads the fmrVideoPlayer form. All member variables are initialized, and the video file is opened as a new Vlc.DotNet.Core.Medias.PathMedia object. A System.Timer is started to generate update events every 500ms.

member.name: M:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.frmVideoPlayer_FormClosing(System.Object,System.Windows.Forms.FormClosingEventArgs)
member.summary: Unloads the frmVideoPLayer form. The player and timer are stopped and the ClosingEvent is fired

member.name: M:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.playVideo
member.summary: Plays the video and change the picturebox icon to reflect this. Fires the PlayEvent.
member.returns: True or False for success. False is returned if the media was not loaded correctly or an exception was thrown
member.remarks: If IsEndOfVideo is True and either IsStopped or IsPaused is True, that means that the player is at the end and the play request will attempt to reset the player to the beginning

member.name: M:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.pauseVideo
member.summary: Pause the video and change the picturebox icon to reflect this. Fires the PauseEvent.
member.returns: True or False for success. Only returns False if an exception is thrown

member.name: M:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.stopVideo
member.summary: Stop the video and change the picturebox icon to reflect this. Fires the StopEvent.
member.returns: True or False for success. Only returns False if an exception is thrown

member.name: M:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.tmrVideo_Tick(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Handles the System.timer tick event. If it is the first one, set up the duration label (the duration cannot be read until the video has started playing). If the video has reached it's duration, fire EndedEvent. At all other times, update the label for the current time that the video has reached.
member.remarks: On the first tick, adds a transparent panel to allow user clicks on the video, since the Vlc.DotNet control does not allow it.

member.name: M:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.getCurrentTime
member.summary: Get the current time from the Position property and the duration of the video.
member.remarks: Multiplies the current position (which is between 0 and 1) by the duration of the video and converts that to a Timespan object.

member.name: M:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.trkCurrentPosition_MovePointer(System.Object,System.Windows.Forms.MouseEventArgs)
member.summary: This mouse handler handles both MouseDown and MouseMove Events for the trackbar. If you press on the trackbar and move it, the video will pause,then seek to that spot and remain paused.

member.name: M:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.trkCurrentPosition_MouseUp(System.Object,System.Windows.Forms.MouseEventArgs)
member.summary: The trackbar MouseUp event just pauses the video. This is here to ensure the video remains paused after seeking with the trackbar

member.name: M:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.m_pnlTransparentPanel_MouseClick(System.Object,System.Windows.Forms.MouseEventArgs)
member.summary: This handles the user clicking on the video by using a transparent panel overlaid on the video. The video will toggle between paused and playing. The Vlc.DotNet control does not capture MouseClick Events on its own so the transparent panel was needed.
member.remarks: If the user clicks the right mouse button, a simple help dialog will pop up

member.name: M:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.videoContextMenuChoice(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: This is the help dialog that appears when the user clicks the right mouse button in the video window.

member.name: M:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.plyrVideo_Ended(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: This handles the Event 'EndReached' fired by the Vlc.DotNet control. It will pause the video, change the current time label to equal the duration label, set the trackbar to position=1, and then fire the EndedBroadcastEvent

member.name: T:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer
member.summary: The frmVideoPlayer class provides a form with an instance of the VLC.dotnet control, a trackbar to show the position of the video, a label for the current position, a label for the duration of the video clip, and a picturebox which shows what is currently happening with the video (playing, stopped, paused).
